alert.note: Alert for Middle Tanana Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 01 at 1:50PM AKST until January 03 at 1:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM AKST MONDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. Expect wind chills to range from 35 below zero to 50 below zero. * WHERE...Fairbanks and the surrounding hills. The coldest wind chills will be across the hills. * WHEN...Now to 1 PM Monday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds gusting as high as 30 mph will cause areas of blowing and drifting snow. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more will create low wind chills. Frost bite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken.
